intro: Mesophlebion arenicola, commonly known as the sandy phlebion, is a rare and specialized plant adapted to arid and sandy environments. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant exhibits a low-growing habit with narrow, linear leaves that reduce water loss. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in umbels, a characteristic feature of the Apiaceae family. Mesophlebion arenicola is typically found in coastal dunes and sandy soils, where it plays a role in stabilizing the habitat.
